alert.note: Alert for Allamakee (Iowa) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS LaCrosse (Southwestern Wisconsin, Southeastern Minnesota, and Northeast Iowa)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 22 at 10:31AM CDT until further notice by NWS LaCrosse
info.description: ...Forecast flooding changed from Minor to Moderate severity and increased in duration for the following rivers in Minnesota... Wisconsin... Mississippi River Near Alma Dam 4 affecting Wabasha and Buffalo Counties. ...Forecast flooding changed from Moderate to Major severity for the following rivers in Minnesota...Iowa...Wisconsin... Mississippi River at Lansing affecting Houston, Crawford, Allamakee and Vernon Counties. .The combination of snow melt and recent rainfall has resulted in rising river levels along the Mississippi River. Moderate to major flooding is expected along the Mississippi River from Lake City, MN to Dubuque, IA. The river will likely crest somewhere between April 25 and April 29 north of La Crosse, and between April 27 and May 1 south of La Crosse. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and major flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Mississippi River at Lansing. * WHEN...Until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 20.0 feet, The Wisconsin Highway 82 river crossing between Highway 35 and Lansing is closed. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 10:15 AM CDT Saturday the stage was 17.4 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 10:15 AM CDT Saturday was 17.4 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to 20.0 feet Friday evening. Additional rises are possible thereafter. - Flood stage is 17.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 19.9 feet on 04/21/2001. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional river and weather information is available at www.weather.gov/lacrosse. The next statement will be issued later this evening.
